recipe.name: Creamy Bacon, Chicken and Broccoli Strata (Bread Bake)
recipe.description: A creamy chicken and broccoli bake made from scratch topped with bread and panko to make it extra crunchy! It's like a pasta bake / strata (savoury bread pudding), just as filling but with a lot less carbs.
recipeIngredient: 250 g / 8 oz   chicken breast fillet (, cut into small bite size pieces)
1/2 cup grated cheese ((tasty, cheddar, gruyere or any other good melting cheese))
3 to 4 slices of thick slice white sandwich bread (, cut into 1cm / 1/3" cubes (note 1))
Fresh parsley (, finely chopped, to garnish (optional))

itemListElement.text: Heat olive oil in a deep non stick fry pan over high heat. Add onion, minced garlic and bacon. Saute for 2 to 3 minutes until onion is translucent and bacon is starting to brown.
itemListElement.name: Heat olive oil in a deep non stick fry pan over high heat. Add onion, minced garlic and bacon. Saute for 2 to 3 minutes until onion is translucent and bacon is starting to brown.

itemListElement.text: Add chicken and cook just until the outside of the chicken turns white (do not cook through). By this time, the onion should be caramelised and bacon should be crisp.
itemListElement.name: Add chicken and cook just until the outside of the chicken turns white (do not cook through). By this time, the onion should be caramelised and bacon should be crisp.

itemListElement.text: Remove from pan onto paper towel to drain.
itemListElement.name: Remove from pan onto paper towel to drain.

recipeInstructions.name: Make the B√©chamel Sauce (see notes for tips)

itemListElement.text: Lower heat to medium. Wipe pan clean and return to heat.
itemListElement.name: Lower heat to medium. Wipe pan clean and return to heat.

itemListElement.text: Melt butter, then add flour and whisk constantly for 1 1/2 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Melt butter, then add flour and whisk constantly for 1 1/2 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Add 1 1/2 cups of milk, whisking constantly, until it is well combined and lump free. It should be very thick.
itemListElement.name: Add 1 1/2 cups of milk, whisking constantly, until it is well combined and lump free. It should be very thick.

itemListElement.text: Add remaining milk and whisk to combine well. Cook for 2 minutes or so, whisking constantly, until it thickens to the consistency of pouring cream (not whipped cream).
itemListElement.name: Add remaining milk and whisk to combine well. Cook for 2 minutes or so, whisking constantly, until it thickens to the consistency of pouring cream (not whipped cream).

itemListElement.text: Remove from heat and add garlic powder, cheese, salt and pepper. Whisk until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth. Do a taste test and add more salt if you want.
itemListElement.name: Remove from heat and add garlic powder, cheese, salt and pepper. Whisk until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth. Do a taste test and add more salt if you want.

itemListElement.text: Place broccoli in baking dish (see notes for size), then top with chicken onion mixture. Pour over half the b√©chamel sauce.
itemListElement.name: Place broccoli in baking dish (see notes for size), then top with chicken onion mixture. Pour over half the b√©chamel sauce.

itemListElement.text: Top with bread cubes, then drizzle over the remaining b√©chamel sauce as evenly as possible over the bread cubes. Use an egg flip to squash the bread cubes down - this helps disperse the b√©chamel sauce throughout the bake.
itemListElement.name: Top with bread cubes, then drizzle over the remaining b√©chamel sauce as evenly as possible over the bread cubes. Use an egg flip to squash the bread cubes down - this helps disperse the b√©chamel sauce throughout the bake.

itemListElement.text: Sprinkle over panko and parmesan cheese.
itemListElement.name: Sprinkle over panko and parmesan cheese.

itemListElement.text: Place in oven and bake for 20 to 25 minutes, until golden brown.
itemListElement.name: Place in oven and bake for 20 to 25 minutes, until golden brown.

itemListElement.text: Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Garnish with finely chopped parsley, if desired.

I was really surprised by this one - it was really yum and great for a winter night. I was looking for a recipe I could use some stale bread in and found this. Probably will sneak some extra veggies in next time but we liked it. We've made a few of your recipes which have been great but I thought I'd comment on this one as a slightly different recipe that people may not try - but I definitely suggest you do!
